ProjectDescr.Title: Genome projects for evolutional studies of the family Acetobacteraceae
ProjectDescr.Description: We are pursuing a research project to comprehend the evolutional status of the family Acetobacteraceae based on genome analyses. First 18 bacterial genomes were projected to read the genome DNA sequences. We will provide data of more bacterial genome and moreover transcriptome by mRNA sequencing.

Grant.Title: Industrial utilization and molecular comprehension of the thermo-tolerance of thermostable fermentation microbes
Grant.Agency: he Program for Promotion of Basic Research Activities for Innovative Biosciences

Grant.Title: Applied studies for biomass utilization based on genome analyses of acetic acid bacteria exhibiting specific metabolic traits.
Grant.Agency: Scientific Research from the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of Japan

Grant.Title: Fermentational approaches for low CO2 exhausting from genome engineering and evolutional adaptation of thermo-tolerant microbes.
Grant.Agency: Advanced Low Carbon Technology Research and Development Program Abbreviation : ALCA

ProjectDescr.Title: NBRP : Genome information of microbial organism related human and environment
ProjectDescr.Description: For the promotion of various studies, we perform genome sequencing of the important 300 microbial organisms to humans and the environment.

Grant.Title: National BioResource Project, Genome Information Upgrading Program
Grant.Agency: The Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science, and Technology, Japan

ProjectDescr.Title: WGS of P. aeruginosa
ProjectDescr.Description: Pseudomonas aeruginosa is one of the most common nosocomial pathogens. Emergence of multidrug-resistant (MDR) P. aeruginosa is a critical problem in medical practice. The key events in the emergence and spread of MDR P. aeruginosa remain unknown. Here, we applied whole-genome sequence (WGS) analyses to define the population structure of 145 MDR P. aeruginosa strains mainly isolated from Japan in addition to Thailand, Vietnam, and Nepal

ProjectDescr.Title: Turtle EvoDevo Project
ProjectDescr.Description: This is the project including genome sequencing of green sea turtle (C. mydas) and Chinese soft shell turtle (P. sinensis), together with RNAseq data during P. sinensis and chicken embryonic development.

ExternalLink.label: Achievements already published on Nature Genetics

ProjectDescr.Title: Strawberry whole-genome sequencing
ProjectDescr.Description: With the aim of investigating of genome structure in Fragaria species, de novo whole genome sequencing was performed in F. Ã— ananassa by using Illumina and Roche 454 sequencing platforms. In parallel, four wild Fragaria species, F. iinumae, F. nipponica, F. nubicola, and F. orientalis, were subjected to whole genome sequences by using an Illumina plat form.

ProjectDescr.Title: Cryptomeria japonica sequencing
ProjectDescr.Description: Cryptomeria japonica is the most important forestry tree species in Japan, adapting to diverse environmental conditions that promoted evolution of the species. This project aims to elucidate the environmental adaptation of the species and to utilize genomic information in breeding programs, producing transcriptome and genome sequences

ProjectDescr.Title: Fungal diversity in natural environment
ProjectDescr.Description: The goal of this project is to elucidate the diversity and composition of fungal community under various natural environments. Our project includes various samples from terrestrial environments such as soil, leaf, and roots. Soil, leaves and roots samples are from forests and agricultural fields.

ProjectDescr.Title: Construction of expressed genes set in common wheat
ProjectDescr.Description: Transcriptome resource of common wheat was constructed from expressed sequence tags (ESTs) including comprehensive full-length cDNAs and EST clones to annotate wheat genomes.

ProjectDescr.Title: metatranscriptome of grass carp intestinal content
ProjectDescr.Description: we sequenced 11 metatranscriptomes of grass carp intestinal contents to explore how the structure and function of the intestinal bacterial communities change driven by different food with various cellulose content

ProjectDescr.Title: Wasmannia genome
ProjectDescr.Description: Little fire ant, Wasmannia auropunctata is invasive species that native to Central and South America. This species successfully invade to new habitat and spread all over the world. In native habitats, W. auropunctata employ a typical Hymenopteran system of reproduction. In introduced areas however, reproduction system is drastically changed, -- queens and males are produced with only maternal and paternal genomes, respectively, whereas sterile workers are produced sexually. Goal of our research is to understand what kind of selections or genomic change are significant for transition of these different tyeps of reproduction systems using samples collected in native and invased area.
